headerDisplay: SnowSense creates an Occupancy Detector called "IsSnowy" that tells you to turn on your snow melting equipment. That means it's going to snow soon or is snowing now or it stopped snowing recently

apiKey.title: OpenWeather API Key (apiKey)
apiKey.description: API key from https://openweathermap.org/api (Subscribe to One Call API 3.0)

apiThrottleMinutes.title: Minutes between weather checks (apiThrottleMinutes)
apiThrottleMinutes.description: How often to check for weather. Don't do it too often or you'll use up your api usage quota.

location.title: Location
location.description: Location is <city>,<state>,<country code> or 5-digit zip code or <latitude>,<longitude>

hoursBeforeSnowIsSnowy.title: Hours before snow starts to trigger 'snowy' (hoursBeforeSnowIsSnowy)
hoursBeforeSnowIsSnowy.description: If snow is forecasted within the next x hours, it's considered snowy.

hoursAfterSnowIsSnowy.title: Hours after snow ends to turn off 'snowy' (hoursAfterSnowIsSnowy)
hoursAfterSnowIsSnowy.description: If snow was seen in the past x hours, it's considered snowy.

onlyWhenCold.title: Only trigger when it is colder than a threshold (onlyWhenCold)
onlyWhenCold.description: Only trigger when it's cold, even if it's snowing. This is useful since snow might not be sticking to the ground if it's too warm.

coldTemperatureThreshold.title: Cold Threshold (coldTemperatureThreshold)
coldTemperatureThreshold.description: Only relevant when "Only When Cold" is turned on. Trigger when it's colder than this temperature. In the given units.

layout.title: Required Settings
layout.description: There are needed to use SnowSense

layout.title: Time Settings
layout.description: These settings about timing of events.
